result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonta Lamont Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deonta Lamont Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deonta Lamont Williams was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving four (4) years of Initial Confinement, combined with sentence in 4CF3719.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.
***Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonta Lamont Williams

records.addlTxt: Petition for sentence adjustment returned as untimely (14CF730) and premature (14CF3719).

Decision and Order Denying Request to Modify Eligibility for Early Release Programs filed and signed by the Court.  The defendant's request to modify his eligibility for the early release programs is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to modify eligibility for early release programs, received in 14CF000730 and 14CF003719.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness James Q. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26206003 in court 1x on 10/13/14.
Witness fee request prepared for James Q. was approved for 1 appearance  on 10/13/14 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.

Defendant Deonta Lamont Williams in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Deonta Lamont Williams in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COUNT 2:   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is  2 YEARS with credit for 6 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving FOUR YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT (COMBINED WITH SENTENCE IN 4CF3719).
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Deonta Lamont Williams in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Deonta Lamont Williams in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4, 5, AND 6:  On motion of the State Court ordered case DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.   

Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUBPOENA RECALLED
